content: déjà vu socks for lazy people mojca čepič aka maramacko photo 1 photo 2 socks size m/l blue and s white the same socks with folded legs the inside looks the same as the outside introduction a few years ago i browsed through elisabeth zimmerman s books and one sweater had cables with a purl stitch in the middle i used those cables in a hat for my dear friend i worked the cables in an overcomplicated way taking care that the purl stitch the knit on the wrong side was always on the top which resulted in a relatively nice wrong side fabric not typical of cables for the scarf which accompanied the hat i tried to combine cables on both sides and in fact that middle purl makes miracles and results in nice double-sided cables i am not sure that double- sided is the proper expression but the resulting fabric is reversible although not entirely equal at both sides we may also call it quasi reversible reversible cables were later studied in a wrap for my late mother-in-law the middle purl offers many many possibilities for quasi reversible fabrics appropriate for shawls scarfs wraps but also for reversible sweaters hats and any other projects where one wants to show both sides of the knitted fabric occasionally as i like socks i was impressed by the main idea of reversai socks these are socks where one can put them on without worrying about the right or the wrong side i knitted them and then i started thinking about various stitch patterns appropriate for reversible socks beside simple knit/purl combinations socks have construction so the stitch pattern has to allow for a heel and toes reversibility as well and as i notoriously love complications here are socks with reversible cables do not worry it was complicated to solve the problems related to reversibility of cables now when problems are solved the pattern is relatively easy only cables require a bit of fiddling with the stitches one more comment the cables which consist of knits and have one or more purl stitches behind the columns that cross in front of them i call open cables they are less dense as regular cables but unfortunately also a bit less elastic in this pattern all cables are open cables but scare fest socks should be in the world of horror and scare there is one with these socks which makes me scared when you take one sock you never know if they are ready are they on 1 the wrong side or the wright side even more have i turned them around already or not have i forgotten what have i done yet… have i seen them as they should be or not déjà vu in its simplest form difficulty level i ntermediate skills required increasing decreasing knit purl elastic cast on working in the round on cable needles or dpns rearranging stitches using cable needles markers or air cabling cabling in general
